info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 2:00PM CST until November 20 at 5:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason, McCulloch, Menard and San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across the western part of the Advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding of low water crossings and streams and creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Saba, Mason, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Fredonia, Pontotoc, Voca, Katemcy, Camp San Saba, Art, Camp Air, Hedwigs Hill, Grit, Sloan, Streeter, Hilda, Loyal Valley, Long Mountain and Skeeterville. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1851 crossing Tiger Creek, RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, crossings along FM 1221, Hurley crossing, Katemcy crossing, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, CR 208 crossing San Saba River and Oak Grove crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Kimble, TX; McCulloch, TX; Mason, TX; Menard, TX; San Saba, TX
